Entries.default:
At the bar, you find a tall man with salt gray hair and strikingly bright blue eyes. His face sports a handful of long scars that continue down his neck and disappear beneath the collar of his shirt.

He looks up from wiping down the counter when you approach and gives you a broad, disarming smile.
"What can I do for you?"
"I want to pay off Taerna's debt."
"I ran into a friend of yours - Eamund the Fox."
"Your tavern looks a lot like an old ship."
"Show me your stock of provisions."
"Farewell."
"I made my position on that clear. You think I've changed my mind?" He gives you a cold stare.

"Got to you, did she? The woman can spot a soft-hearted mark from fifty paces. Like a sixth sense or somethin'. Remarkable." He nods to you conspiratorially, as if he didn't just imply you were a sucker easily parted from your money.
"No friend of mine. Let me guess - he claimed I recruited you, and that I'm coming out of retirement?"
"I don't see why no one ever believes me when I tell 'em that I've put that life behind me... 'specially since I tend to kill 'em after." He shakes his head.
"In any case, I suspect ol' weasel-faced Eamund didn't survive his encounter with you. Dumb bastard never did know when to back down."

"You're right, though. Inherited on old dhow from my da when he passed. Right piece of shit it was, too. Realized I was bound to make more coin turning her into a tavern than letting her rot in her berth."
"So long as you show me some coin."
"I've heard rumors you're the Red King, the infamous pirate."
"Infamous to his enemies, famous to his friends." He narrows his eyes and sizes you up before saying more.
"Folks deciding to call me the Red King... I had nothing to do with that. But I didn't tell 'em to stop, neither." He grins.
"Got right tired of ship hunters crawling up my ass every time I went out to sea, though. So I paid off my crew, scuttled this ship here, and went my merry way."
"Got any fire kelp extract for sale?"
"Sure do. And at a 'generously' discounted price, too - two hundred fifty pires."
"I'll take a vial of the extract."
"Be careful you don't get any of it in your eyes. Burns like a mothe- uh, burns like you wouldn't believe. Wouldn't wish that sting on anybody, not even my worst enemy."
"Figured that out all on your own, did you?" He winks.
"How many coins do you think I can fit in your mouth until you choke to death on 'em?"
"What if I double the money?"
"If folks hear you're keeping a debtor as a slave, they might not be so keen to gamble here, savvy?"

"Unless there's something else you need, I think we're done here." He turns away and begins fiddling with something beneath the bar. As he does, you spy red-handled pistols stuffed into the band of his breeches.

"Look at you, big spender!

"Word of caution, now - you don't wanna look too desperate around here. Pirates can sniff that out easy as stink on fish." He winks.

"Hah! I haven't met someone brave enough to step to me in, oh, s'gotta be two weeks now. And THAT guy ended up shot full of holes!

"Right tragic accident, it was."
"That's a shrewd observation. Maybe you're not so easy a mark after all." He rubs at the stubble along his jaw, lost in thought. Then he shrugs and flashes you that too-bright grin.
"Taerna's free to go."
"Let's discuss something else."
"Will you take something else in exchange for her freedom?"
"If I wanted something else, I'd have asked for it."
"Haven't see you around before. Welcome to The King's Coffin." His smile is wide enough to show his bright, white teeth, but his light eyes remain cold and flinty.
"...Actually, yeah. Yeah, I would." He chuckles deeply to himself as he hands you the vial of fire kelp extract.
"Here's the thing, though - it's more profitable for me to keep her under my thumb, so, sweet as your offer is, you can keep your money."
"You've got guts, I'll give you that. Maybe you're not so easy a mark after all." He throws his head back and laughs.
"See, the Vailian Republics drove my da out of business, and I repaid them in kind by taking their ships and their treasure - a whole lot of it."

"In other words, the Red King is dead.

"And if you ask me any more about it, you will be, too."
"I wanted to buy something."
"What do you want?"
"I'd like to rent a room."
"You know of any sailors looking for work? I need crew."
"So long as you don't mind pirates, sure."
"Got any regulars looking for a little adventure?"
"There's always someone about who can't say no to good coin."
"How heavy's your coin purse?"
"I wanted to ask you something else."
[Leave.]
"Uh huh."
"Never mind."
